sentence.text: Abnormalities in nucleic acid processing are associated with the development of amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (signal transduction) and frontotemporal dementia (FTD).

Mutations in Matrin 3 (activation of innate immune response), a poorly understood DNA- and RNA-binding protein, cause familial signal transduction/FTD, and MATR3 pathology is a feature of sporadic disease, suggesting that MATR3 dysfunction is integrally linked to ALS pathogenesis.
